website_summaries.verdict: A comfortable and feature-rich mouse that comes with a Unifying receiver, so you can use up to six compatible mice or keyboards with it.
pros: Features a contoured shape, and soft rubber grips
Features include back/forward buttons, side-to-side scrolling, and a Unifying receiver USB plug
Available in blue, red, or black
Comes with two AA batteries that last up to two years
Wireless connection is good up to 33 feet
cons: Some features of this require you to install Logitech Options software (available on their site)
Scroll wheel can be noisy and loose, or not work well in general

website_summaries.verdict: With more shortcut buttons than you'll know what to do with, the Logitech M510 is the best budget mouse for anyone tired of dragging their fingers around a trackpad.
pros: You can customize shortcut tasks for all seven buttons on the Logitech M510 mouse and the laser tracks smoothly across nearly any surface except glass
The battery lasts two years with daily use and Logitech's micro-receiver frees up precious USB ports by connecting multiple Logitech accessories with a single dongle
cons: The directional buttons on the left side limits this mouse to right-handed users only

customer_reviews.title: Double clicks after a year.
customer_reviews.text: This is to replace the first one I got and I loved it so much I got another when, after a year of hard use, it started doing a double click when it was pushed once. I don't care because it was a great "normal" mouse with all of the bells and whistles while not trying to be something different. UPDATE: I loved this mouse BUT: I ordered my first one in August of '16. It started to do double clicks, deleting thing I didn't want deleted. I ordered another one September of '17. Now it's February of '18 and my second one is doing the same thing. New batteries don't help. I ordered a different brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brant

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy a unifying receiver separately!
customer_reviews.text: Just realized I have to buy a fifteen dollar USB thing to stick into my computer so it can read this stupid thing. Might as well buy a cord while I'm at it, make this a corded cordless mouse for added convenience. Why the unifying receiver isn't included with the mouse is beyond me. Well, I guess it's not that hard to figure out - they want to knock fifteen bucks off the price tag of the mouse, then stick it to you later! In the words of Bill O'Reilly: "F@@kin' thing SUCKS!!!"
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B. Stiff

customer_reviews.title: Awful Scroll Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a mouse with a scroll wheel that keeps scrolling after I've released it. I've tried different settings in Windows 10 and nothing works. I've tried changing it to scroll one screen at a time and even experimented with the number of lines for it to scroll and nothing will stop it from scrolling beyond the point from where it should stop. It eventually stops, but not where I stop moving it. I would return it, but I threw away the original packaging. My old Logitech M305 stopped working, but I had it for years. I used to trust Logitech to make quality products, but they lost me on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lame. This WAS my favorite mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This was my third Logitech M510 and by far the worst. It didn't even last 2 years before it started having problems. I've tried new batteries and in multiple computers to eliminate variables. The issue is the buttons, both left and right, are either failing to click or unclicking themselves when I am holding it down. As you can imagine clicking and dragging is infuriating with this issue. I have to "double click" things that only require a single click because it didnt engage or just fails to click. This was my favorite mouse style but, I am extremely skeptical of buying another one. Maybe its build quality. Maybe it was a lemon. Either way, I'm disappointed. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Wobbles

customer_reviews.title: Left button only lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Left button only lasted 5 months Purchase Date: 5/07/2020 After 5 months, the left mouse button works erratically. The problems include: - on a single-click, it often sends a double-click - when holding the button down, a release of button is often sent. This is evident during a "drag and drop". This is the 2nd Logitech M510 were this issue has occurred. Attempted to submit a warranty replacement at Logitech but it was not possible. The website led me in a circular path that did not allow a submission.
customer_reviews.author: cmanduran

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable for me as the M705
customer_reviews.text: My previous Logitech mouse lasted several years but began to take single clicks and turn them into double clicks. I had to abandon that failed M705. However the M705 was made for right handed people like myself but the new M510 is ambidextrous. That doesn't mean it fits both hands well. It just means it fits both hands equally. I didn't buy another M705 because users complained that the latest versions were manufactured with sub par materials and there were missing features. If Logitech is going to change the product then they should change the name. Other than the fit this mouse works fine. I bought and like the red one. It is not gold colored as another reviewer said.
customer_reviews.author: J. DonaldsonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: v bad for medium and large hands but kind to small hands
customer_reviews.text: the palm part of this logitech is too narrow and will only be perfect for small hands I used insulation tape to place blocks of plastic to the left side of mouse to compensate the palm width to handle a medium size hand and give it the full width which you see on an ergonomic microsoft mouse for a $23 mouse I am pretty disappointed that I had to make modifications in its shape to use it
customer_reviews.author: .Net learner

customer_reviews.title: Receiver Failed After 1 year, Warranty 30 Days Only
customer_reviews.text: Been using this mouse for a little over a year. A couple months ago, it started spontaneously disconnecting and reconnecting. Absolutely maddening. Tried the online fixes, no help. Discovered wiggling the receiver helped it reconnect but it would disconnect again seconds later. Finally ordered a new Logitech unifying receiver, tossed the original one that came with the mouse and it's working fine again. Noticed the new receiver had a much tighter fit in the USB port than the receiver that came with this mouse. Putting this out there in case anyone else experiences the same problem. Update: Contacted Logitech WRT 3-year hardware warranty. They responded that the 3-yr warranty only applies if purchased through Logitech. Buyer beware :(
customer_reviews.author: Shop Therapy

customer_reviews.title: this mouse does exactly what i need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I order the Logitech M510 Wireless Computer Mouse because i wanted to get rid of all the wiring mess from my computer and wanted to upgrade. I look around, researched and found this mouse with a nice low price budget of $20. It has the left and right buttons with a scroll button which acts as a third clicker and a back/forth buttons on the left top side next to the thumb. everything is very responsive and scrolling/third clicking function works and has no problems I had this for 3 months and everything seem a-ok....I'll let you know within one year time
customer_reviews.author: James Sunderland

customer_reviews.title: WOBBLY WHEEL!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing mouse. It looks and feels great, but within a week of use the wheel started wobbling around from side to side and making an annoying noise. I've had to return it for a refund. If you search the reviews, you will see that this is a common issue: Some customers report buying up to three of these mice and all of them having this same problem. I don't understand why Logitech cannot fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Franklin

customer_reviews.title: When it worked, it was great.
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer said, this mouse stopped working after 2 months. For me, it was about a week shy of 2 months. I changed the batteries, unplugged/re-plugged 100 times, restarted my computer, gave it a few days rest... And still nothing. Now I receive the "device not supported" error... In case it is helpful, I use(d) it with an Asus laptop that was purchased new at the beginning of this year. If you are looking for something that will last over 2 months, I would not recommend purchasing this one.
customer_reviews.author: OWEN2013

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Not as described!
customer_reviews.text: The description of this product states that "the compact size makes it easy to take with you wherever you use your computer—at home, at work, or anywhere else." It goes on to claim that the item dimensions are "3.5 x 3 x 2 in." That is incorrect! This mouse actually measures 4.75" in length. I was looking for a compact mouse to travel with my notebook... this is not it (it is actually bigger than my desktop mouse!). Returned immediately! Rather disappointing to have to go through this trouble - because the description is so wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gaul

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: My 10-12 year old Logitech mouse crapped out so I decided to get another Logitech. First I got a keyboard/mouse combo which came with the Logitech M275 mouse. It's ok, kinda cheap, and feels small so I order this one. This one is even worse. The size is fine, but the wheel feel ridiculously cheap, it's noisy and very rough. I guess Logitech just makes cheap crap now? They used to be really good. No chance this mouse will last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Big wireless mouse, comfortable, smooth
customer_reviews.text: This is bigger than the last wireless mouse I used. I have small hands, so it took a little bit of time to get used to. Now it feels really comfortable. It's a smooth-moving, nice mouse. I like the side scrolling wheel. Don't care much for the forward/back buttons on the side, but that's okay. It's been a nice product to have. Definitely recommend anything logitech over these other weird brands that you only ever see on Amazon and not ever in a real store. I had one of those cheap non-name brand mice in the past. Lasted for a few months before crapping out.
customer_reviews.author: QueenDopamine

customer_reviews.title: A great mouse for general use
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great for office use. I would not recommend for more than casual gaming (Logitech has a great wireless gaming mouse if that is what you want - you'll want the reduced wireless lag). +Reasonably comfortable. One of the few larger mice out there. It's getting hard to find a decent sized mouse from the main manufacturers recently. They all seem to be what used to be a laptop size. + The Logitech wireless app makes adding a mouse or keyboard easy. + Batteries last pretty long. There are better mice out there but if you want a mouse that will be comfortable for most people and most office type situations - this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: James TTop Contributor: Writing

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a minute to figure out the USB piece was in the battery compartment and needed to be plugged into the laptop to connect the mouse. Once that was plugged in, the connection happened immediately and hasn’t required a reconnection since. I had a mouse that required recharging and reconnecting every time the laptop fell asleep. This one is a huge improvement and fits my hand nicely. It is on the large side.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: It was a decent mouse at first, but then went downhill fast. Every time you use it now, it requires a little bang on the desk to work. Its the battery section which has issues, the come in and out of contact frequently. So find a better option than this pile of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cook

customer_reviews.title: No Thanks...
customer_reviews.text: After this purchase I will probably not consider Logitech for a future mouse. This thing in 50% bigger than any regular mouse. It has two batteries which makes it twice as heavy. It is an ugly blue, much darker than shown in the photos. The side buttons are programmed to scroll back and forth through web pages which is not very important to me. It works okay, but feels very weird. You would need the hands of an orangutan to fit this mouse. I also bought an M325 mouse which is much better, but kind of cheap feeling. Logitech is not so great anymore.
customer_reviews.author: chuckbobuck

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 18 months
customer_reviews.text: The mouse worked great for 18 months, then suddenly the left click button started having intermittent problems. Now, when I resize windows or drag an object on the screen, the action is suddenly and randomly interrupted. I expect a mouse to last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice form factor, good weight, easily accessible batteries and compartment to stow USB, good pointer tracking and precision, customizable buttons, good grip. Cons: My biggest issues are with the scroll wheel. It doesn't have a snug fit and rattles around a bit, especially side to side. It is also fairly jerky and does not scroll smoothly (not much resolution). Lastly, the click sounds for the buttons are much higher pitched than other mice I have and a bit grating (though maybe my ears will learn to tune this out in time). In sum, it will work, but I also wish I had found another mouse I liked as much as my old microsoft one (that I was replacing).
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kubiak

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE LOGITECH
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is the name for mouse and computer accessories. It always has. I'm sold on Logitech because they make the best products for computers. I had a Logitech mouse long time ago and it served its purpose well. Then I switched to HP (Hewlett-Packard) because I thought it was cheaper but it wasn't because it ended up breaking on me. I then went back to Logitech and will always buy from them. This mouse in particular is very sensitive and the motioning is great. It has 2 small batteries inside and you use a tiny USB to plug it into your computer because it is a wireless mouse. I highly recommend this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mainecoon Cat

customer_reviews.title: Cursor Doesn't Track
customer_reviews.text: I can't even use this--the cursor simply doesn't track worth a damn. Received on time, plugged in and recognized with no issue (Windows/Huawei Matebook Pro) but using the mouse on my clean stainless steel table, the cursor is simply all over the place or stuck in one spot, jumping past where I've set it to go. Not sure what the deal is and why this is so highly rated. My last Logitech mouse worked so well until the left button just straight up stopped working (apparently this happens). Is there a wireless mouse out there that just works??
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Three years of service and still as strong as ever
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse to use at work, because the mouse they provide you at work doesn't have a mouse 4 and 5 button, and I'm not about to go back to the stone ages of actually *clicking* the "back" button in my browser. This thing is ergonomic, responsive, and dependable. I've never had issues with the wireless connection. This thing is also durable; I'm always throwing it in my backpack or laptop bag so it has taken a lot of stress and still performs like a champ. It uses a non-rechargeable battery, but I only need to replace it roughly once a year even though I'm using it all day five days a week.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Stuff

customer_reviews.title: my perfect mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these for multiple computers because it fits my large hands perfectly, responds perfectly, has perfect battery conservation, and is simple yet elegant. It has a multi-directional click and scroll wheel, two side scroll buttons that I can't live without. The unifying receiver is great. It has rubber sides that I love, but I have had one of these for many years and I have created a tiny wear and tear divot in the rubber thumb rest, which fits my thumb perfectly. I have tried many mice, but I still buy and even gift this little m510 mouse because it is solid.
customer_reviews.author: The human

customer_reviews.title: Great movement control and range signal
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for less than a week but I've used it for 24 hours now while working from home and it has worked perfectly. The mouse on my laptop screen moves smoothly and far distances with little movement of my wrist. The USB range is tiny so it's almost like it's not really there as far as taking up space and doesn't mess with any of my laptop's device plugin functionalities or settings. As long as the range is plugged in, the mouse is fully functional immediately after turning it on. Oh, and the the back & forward buttons on the side for web page surfing are pretty nice too
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Garcia

customer_reviews.title: buttons on side
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse, but I ordered it not knowing that there were buttons on the side (that aren't on "normal" mouses). The buttons on the side are a nuisance, I already know how to surf the web (I use mouse gestures with Vivaldi, Opera etc) I don't need any special hardware. Anyhow I keep pressing the buttons by mistake and I keep getting sent places I don't want to go. I wish I could turn the buttons off or remove them. Otherwise this is a good mouse. I haven't noticed the "Sleep Mode" I don't know what that is.... I probably wouldn't like that either whatever it is.
customer_reviews.author: Baker Bob

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: According to my order history I bought this mouse for my home PC in Oct 2017. Less than one year later it is malfunctioning. Makes a double-click action when I only click the mouse once. This is causing all sorts of problems for pretty much everything I do on my PC. The mouse is used at a home PC only and really doesn't get used all that much. Getting theto try since it is almost half the price. Haven't had bad luck with Logitech mice or keyboard until now, but this is something that should not fail after less than 1 year. And, yes, I replaced the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy758600

customer_reviews.title: ***Mouse is made for very large handed person***
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands for a woman, so you would think a normal gaming mouse would fit me. But this one is clumsy, and not set up for conveinience in the overall buttons and pressing modes. A small or even medium woman's hands wouldn't work, nor would a medium or small man's hands. That is so important it should be in the item description. Someone with larger hands has trouble finding items that they can easily benefit from, such as this. So that is why I lowered the rating somewhat. It slows me down when I play certain games because of the manipulation delay.
customer_reviews.author: Deb F.

customer_reviews.title: Scroll wheel stopped working after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: The scroll wheel stopped working suddenly. I troubleshooted the problem and determined it is in the mouse, not the firmware, or port conflicts, or a bad receiver or resetting the software, or rebooting the computer. I tried a back-up mouse using the same receiver and no problems. Therefore, the mouse is bad - after only 7 months! It is hard to believe that in this day and age that some company cannot produce a reliable, long-lasting mouse. I almost think the manufacturers intentionally make mice doomed to fail quickly so they can get repeat business. BTW, I've tried a lot of manufacturers and they all are unreliable. It's a scam!
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for users, but not gamers.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this mouse works well for workstations, but not for gamers. The gamers probably want something more accurate-- the laser is offset on this mouse, compared to being in the center of the mouse like most gaming mice. This one does have great battery life though. The back and forward buttons work like they're supposed to, and the rubberized grip on the side does make things a bit more classy and comfortable. The rubber will wear down eventually, but I'm talking like 5 years from now, unless you're super acidic or something.
customer_reviews.author: Mykii

customer_reviews.title: What a brick
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the worst mouse I've ever used. Large and awkward size. heavy due to 2 batteries. Will not glide over any surface: glass, plastic, leather or mouse pad. Click button only semi depresses- no definite tactile click- so you have to look at the screen to see if it's working. I've used Logitech for decades because it was good stuff but this one is awful. Already ordered a replacement and it's not Logitech this time.
customer_reviews.author: SCJ

customer_reviews.title: It has the features you need
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech M510 has been my go-to mouse for a long time because it is a solid performer, with important features like back AND forward buttons - but this particular purchase only lasted a couple months before the scroll wheel got completely wonky. I actually got so annoyed by the wheel and ended up replacing it with a Microsoft (my favorite MS mouse is discontinued btw, which is sad... that's why I do gravitate to the Logitech M510). We have several M510's at the office and, while they work well enough, I think that the company should focus more Q/A attention to the scroll wheel...
customer_reviews.author: L.H.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I ordered this mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is just awesome! I will admit that I was almost returned it without even opening it. I assumed that I had ordered a small Logitech mouse like the one that I currently used. I didn't look at the dimensions when i placed the order. So initially I was mad at myself. But I said what the heck, I might was well try it. Well I have say, I am very impressed with the responsiveness of this mouse and the way it feels in my hand. I liked it so much that I immediately re-ordered one for my home. This one I bought for my office. I definitely recommend it. Worth more than $20 that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Liz

customer_reviews.title: Happy at first, but it didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse in September 2018, and less than eight months later, the left click button became inoperable. This was just used for part-time office work. I'm not a gamer or anything, just your basic Microsoft Office, email, and surfing, so it's not like the left click button got any strenuous use or anything. I paid more for the Logitech brand, and I'm very disappointed that it didn't last long. Today I purchased the VicTsing to replace it. Yeah, it's an off-brand, but it's half the price and has great reviews. So even if it lasts only eight months, it only cost half as much as the Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Rita R.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This is like the only mouse (or similar model Logitech) i order over and over like 6 times and i've lost count and typically an amazing product. They usually last a long time but this one only lasted 5 months, may have been a lemon the wheel always seemed a little wonky and now you have to press it hard for it to work, the pointer button was doing the same thing for a little while. The 3 stars is not for the mouse model, it's a solid mouse, my 3 stars is because this one i bought failed me, and to be clear and fair i should note that the rest lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Requires additional new software
customer_reviews.text: This is a "new" M510. Setpoint doesn't work. You need "Options", crippled drivers from Logitech that do not even support pointer acceleration. Plus you need to leave Setpoint in place for your five older Logitech input devices. Totally defeats the purpose of the "Unifying Receiver"; the driver software is no longer unified. I bought two, and discarded the packaging on one. That mouse will follow the packaging and the other will be returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Schatzlein

customer_reviews.title: Full sized mouse with no annoying sleep function and fast response
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would be a viable replacement for a Microsoft mouse. I've tried other mice sold on Amazon and were of the right size, but there were problems such as the transmitter not working beyond a few feet or a highly annoying power saving feature that activates too often, cannot be turned off and doesn't always reply quick enough. None of those problems exist with this mouse and, if you have large hands, this is the mouse for you. Nice grip, smooth glide and fast response on my Linux system.
customer_reviews.author: DataHaunt

customer_reviews.title: Just your standard mouse
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech M510 is your standard Bluetooth mouse. Plug the USB receiving into you computer (or the dongle if you have a new MacBook) and get to work. Not impressed with the range of the Bluetooth. I have to leave the USB receiver in direct line of sight with the mouse for it to work. I know it's 2 years in, but I am having trouble with the left click too. Sometimes it will release the click as I am trying to highlight or drag something, which can be annoying when editing videos. Overall it's a decent mouse. Nothing to write home to about, but not much to complain about either. Servicable.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play...again!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second mouse from Logi. It's basically the same model, only newer. My old one died, and I liked it so much I ordered this one. So far, it has not disappointed me. I appreciate how I can just plug the USB adaptor in, slap in some batteries, turn the mouse on and start working. I am not a Gamer. I am a full-time seminary student, part-time office admin from home. This mouse gets a LOT of use! I also like the color. I ordered the graphite model, a nice matte finish, soft touch. NIce little mouse!
customer_reviews.author: T.  Page

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working for me
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a five because it was what I asked for- a working mouse. It stopped working after maybe 10 days. Lucky me, I could still return it. The eye underneath stopped, believe me I checked the batteries and I turned it off and on... It was disappointing. A product that went through quality control should not do it- How about some quality?
customer_reviews.author: Eden Shmuel

customer_reviews.title: Two Out of Three Ain't Bad
customer_reviews.text: I used a Logitech M705 Mouse for years. Until one day Windows 10 decided that it hated the Logitech M705 Mouse. That drove me to purchase my first Logitech M510 Mouse. The M510 doesn't have quite the build quality of the M705. It's a simpler mouse, which makes it better for gaming. I've purchased a total of 3 of these mice so far. One blue, one red, and one black. I still have the blue and black mice. The red mouse fell apart in my hand in the middle of a game after a year. I guess two out of three ain't bad.
customer_reviews.author: EMan

customer_reviews.title: Returning this one
customer_reviews.text: I only ever use Logitech mouses/keyboards (and like having a different one for all of my work and home laptops and desktops), and this mouse is terrible. Only got this since I liked the blue/black color combo, but this feels cheaply made, it's much larger than my other ones and this one is missing the unifying receiver to boot (the slot in the mouse that houses it arrived empty and no it's not floating around in the mouse or packaging). Will be returning and trying to find the other version I usually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Girl

customer_reviews.title: Wireless and Battery Efficient Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Do you get that itch to use a mouse wirelessly? How about the reliability? I’d think battery life is important as well, yes? Look no further - this mouse is for you! I’ve been using this mouse daily for the last few months. I just toss it into my bag, with the power switched off (obviously), and off I go. I work in IT and have to travel frequently with my laptop and wireless mouse, and this one does the trick. No need to purchase a high-end wireless mouse unless you enjoy spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: Schlombat

customer_reviews.title: And, it's dead
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these mice, hoping to have one at home and then one in the office. Well, my second mouse has died and the first mouse died at the beginning of COVID-19 -so March 2020. I bought this second mouse february 2020 and now it's September and it's glitching, freezing, and making it hard to use. I tried changing the batteries but the problem has persisted. Overall, when the mouse isn't dying, it works really well and fits in the hand well. It just keeps dying. You get about 7-13 months of life out of these mice, which is nice and the battery lasts forever, but beware, you will need a new mouse in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be fake, doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse to replace another Logitech M510 that finally got a little tempermental. I love the one I had, it just felt right and worked (until it didn't). So I got the same one again, or so I thought. The one I received appears to be a fake. The Logitech logo is in a different place, the optical sensor is made differently and is in a different spot, and the right click button doesn't work at all. It also weighs SIGNIFICANTLY less than my othe M510, and just feels flimsy overall. Don't know what happened, but I just oredered another one, and this time I hope I get the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Marty B.

customer_reviews.title: hard to click the left mouse button all the way. Possibly defective.
customer_reviews.text: As noted, when I hold the mouse in a position comfortable to me, it is difficult to click the left mouse button all the way. Sometimes the button will not click all the way and therefore the click does not register on the screen. If I move my hand more forwards, then I can click it more properly but this is not a natural, comfortable position. I have not had this experience with a previous Logitech mouse I used for many years. Also, I do not notice this issue with the right mouse button. Therefore, I have to conclude that this mouse probably has a defective left mouse button. Disappointing. Logitech quality control must be going down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel, but not overly reliable
customer_reviews.text: Over the past two years I've purchased three of these Logitech M510 mice for different computers. They feel good and fit my big hand well. Would buy another if it weren't for problems creeping up. The original one keeps dropping its connection to the small USB dongle. It takes briefly unplugging the dongle to reestablish communication. Sometimes all is good for days, other times a few minutes. The second mouse has begun adding extra left-clicks to the desired left-click. Very frustrating when using something like an on-screen keyboard. The third mouse is working OK for now. I've ordered a mouse from a different company in hopes that it will fit as well and be more durable than the M510.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Gasaway

customer_reviews.title: I Bought this in 2011 and it is still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I was checking my old purchases and realized that I bought this in 2011 and it is still going strong in 2020 - really. What I like best about it is a small detail - around the outside of the top, around the two buttons, is a curved rim, it is just the right location to rest my middle finger and thumb. Many mice have just the buttons on the top. It is a bit heavy, substantial, but it glides smoothly. I like that, someone else might not. It fits my hands and the scroll wheel is smooth. The right and left sides are textures.
customer_reviews.author: Ideas from Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Mouse out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is just terrible. I wish I could return it but I'm currently overseas. The mouse is not accurate it seems to be "haunted." Secondly when I try to "copy" some text a lot of times it "un-clicks" by itself meaning that I would have to try multiple times to "copy" and "paste" This is going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: If either of my computers were to go to sleep/idle, this mouse just wouldn’t work. I tried cycling power on it and reconnecting the receiver...nada. Then, at some random interval after losing hope, it would just snap to and the driver would be found and mouse worked. Well, that doesn’t cut it, especially since my Microsoft wireless mouse that’s 10 years older than it never has these issues even still. I smashed this mouse (because that’s what you do with crap electronics) and I’m going to find a replacement from another company.
customer_reviews.author: End The Fed

customer_reviews.title: Unusable on Mac - stutters, laggy, jumpy, no product support
customer_reviews.text: Set this up to use with my Mac. Worked fine for a day - then it became totally unusable with constant jumping / lagging / stuttering. Checked online, apparently there is a known issue on macs that has no clear explanation or resolution. Logitech website has multiple software versions listed, no clue which to download. Found the right one, downloaded it, Mac says it can't install as it was made for 32 bit OSs. Why is this even listed as a Mac compatible mouse? Sadly threw out the packaging or I would be returning this to buy literally anything else.
customer_reviews.author: janelle

customer_reviews.title: NIce but a little off
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mouse, it just doesn't fit my hand well. The small ones are too small. So i tried this one. It fits my needs and is mostly comfortable. Just wished it fit in the palm of my hand better. Due to this the thumb buttons are not in a good location for me to operate efficiently. Overall the mouse works great & I am pleased. The only reason for deducting 1 star is that in order for it to be 100%, it would need to fit better in my palm. I am keeping it & will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product
customer_reviews.text: My last wireless mouse died and I bought this one based upon Amazon reviews. I've only had this mouse for 10 or 11 days but installation was automatic and so far it works like a champ! Unless it stops working soon then I think this is a good buy. If the mouse does stop working I will update my review but so far I have nothing but positives about the mouse. Good product for the price and I recommend it if you use a wireless mouse. BTW, I don't "game" so I did not rate "For gaming."
customer_reviews.author: JNMNR

customer_reviews.title: Super nice
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other wireless mice before and this one tracks very precise and has a great palm feel with some weight to it for moving around even on a mouse pad. Couldn't be happier with it. I'm an I.T. guy and this would be the one to get. The other cheapies I've tried don't hold a charge for more than a day or two of use and some are twitchy and you almost have to feel like a surgeon to zero in on areas to click on. Not this mouse. I've noticed within 5mins that its going to save me a ton of time and annoyances because it tracks soooo nice!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Gebert

customer_reviews.title: Left mouse button fails after <1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: As another customer found, indeed the left mouse button fails after less than 1 year. Incredible...I have wired mice (Microsoft) that the buttons still work perfectly on after 10 years of use. This is definitely a design flaw by Logitech - really disappointed as everything else about this mouse is perfect. The left mouse button will not stay "clicked" with normal use pressure...it will unclick/reclick seemingly at random, but seems the contact points inside wear out fast. Can't recommend this mouse due to the above, however. 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J___

customer_reviews.title: Fine mouse but
customer_reviews.text: this is an excellent mouse, however. after i received it i realized that i did not need it. my laptop only has usb a on the left side and i use my mouse on the right. believe it or not this hp laptop will not work well with a mouse that has the transmitting chip on the opposite side. who at hp never figured that out? I got a usb adapter so that i could install the transmitter chip on the right side and then my old mouse worked fine. however i like the new one so much better i decided to keep it and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lauby

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Logitech mice over the years and this one is a fantastic all-rounder. For $25 it's crazy good value. I've had some that were double the price and now I realize they were overkill for me. I switch it between my work and my personal laptop all the time seamlessly. The connection is quick and strong, initial pairing is easy, and it works on most surfaces. The battery life is impressive as well. Probably not great for serious gaming, but I don't care about that.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mathe

customer_reviews.title: I really like this medium size mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I've always purchased Logitech mice because they are great. For my primary PC which I sit at all day long, I have the Performance MX and I wouldn't trade it for anything. But when I'm on the road using my 13" laptop, I just need a slightly smaller mouse that fits in my bag and is equally comfortable. I had a smaller mouse before, but it was too small, so this M510 is actually quite perfect for that. And the bonus is that the battery really lasts quite a long time if you remember to shut it off.
customer_reviews.author: JonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse; lousey finger pads
customer_reviews.text: Functional, fits my hand, comfortable, long battery life, smooth on most surfaces. I would buy another one. Now the bad -- the "rubber" thumb pad wears away (disintegrates) with a grimy, blue, pasty film that rolls up under my thumb. I have cleaned the pad with soap&water, alcohol, hand lotion, and baby oil. Nothing stops the wear; may I have "acid" thumb! However I keep a very clean thumb and fingers and still I get the pad wear. the wear is very extensive under the thumb, but negligible on the finger side. The thumb is the big mover of the mouse. The holes in the pad are completely gone in the middle; I suspect it is worn about 1/2 thru.
customer_reviews.author: Ol' Man

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse for long hours
customer_reviews.text: I know there are contenders out there that are considered "Power User", but for speed, comfort, and reliability you can't beat the M510. When my M510 died I purchased the next level up. After a couple of weeks my shoulder began to ache and no matter how I adjusted my desk, chair or arm I could not ease the pain. Could be my hand is too small or the new height of the mouse caused the issue, but since I had no pain with the M510, I switched back and can once again work for hours with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: amyellen

customer_reviews.title: Like others said...it works great...then stops working properly
customer_reviews.text: Long story short - I had one of these for years and wanted the exact same experience...well, I bought it and now, 6 months later it is double and triple clicking out of the blue. It is seriously annoying...and a little embarrassing as I just sent an email that was not ready to go. This mouse goes in the recycle bin and a new brand for sure for the next one. By the way - I have never had a mouse that fit my hand so well...so I am super bummed that this one gave up the ghost so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: IanP

customer_reviews.title: What Happened to My Old M510s?!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for this review but.... I have used this brand and model of mouse for years and years and these will not work! I bought 2 and neither will work properly. The side click buttons refuse to work even with the Logitech Set Point software even with repeated resetting. The regular right and left click refuse to operate smoothly, sometimes taking several clicks to finally get something selected. I am using Win 7 on one PC and Win 10 on another and they both behave the same. What happened to my old M510s?! Wish I had some old models that would work. These would go in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, the perfect size, and nice features
customer_reviews.text: I was just looking for a mouse that fits my hand well. I used to have a sleek, non-gripped Microsoft mouse that was a tad too small and I could feel my hand cramping after a while of use. This one fits my hand perfectly (5'8'' male, average-sized hands). The forward/back buttons on the side weren't something I was looking for but they are a nice bonus and speed up web browsing once you make a habit of actually using them. The side have a rubber grip, which is a must for me. I can't stand using a non-gripped mouse because the oil on your hands will eventually make them uncomfortable to grasp.
customer_reviews.author: Martin S

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! Inconsistent Connection
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to over reviewers. After not even a month I started having issues. It's like it's rapidly connecting and disconnecting repeatedly all day. For example, if I go into paint and try to "draw" a line, it appears as a series of dashes across the screen, the blank spaces being where it's losing connection. I've tried every USB port on my computer, different batteries, updated drivers, nothing works. Really ticked off I wasted a notable chunk of money on this crap. I will never buy a Logitech product again.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy an older style of Microsoft mouse they no longer make and I finally ran out of spares a few years ago and have been bouncing around with cheap $5-$15 mice replacing them every 3-6 months. The battery life is amazing at over a month depending on battery brand you use, the comfort of it is outstanding and every button works well and is easily reachable. After heavy use over a month I can barely even see any wear on it.
customer_reviews.author: Yoduh

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an MX mouse with this one. If you have an existing Logitech dongle for your current mouse or keyboard, just plug in the new dongle in a different USB port, the Unifying software will pop-up and ask you if you’d like to use the new dongle or the existing one. Just follow the on-screen promos based upon your selection of dongles to use. The mouse is very responsive and the Logitech’s software menu works great to customize its features.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Server

customer_reviews.title: Mouse malfunction after 12 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Mouse is great, feels great in my hand, responsive, buttons are macro-able, and battery life is good. However, after only 12 months of use the mouse has developed issues with clicking. It will either click once, double click, or not click at all when I press the left mouse button. After a quick google search I found that this was a very common issue. I've only used logitech mice my whole life and unfortunately all of them have issues after 1-2 years (I used to use their $80 gaming mice and stopped after they kept dying randomly). Safe to say I am done with Logitech mice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: roller ball is different
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time i have purchased this mouse for my home office. The first time the mouse is perfect quiet (few years old) and moves like it should (smoothly). This latest second mouse the roller ball has a hollow sounding noise when it rolls and it feels different like it needs to be tightened. I ddo not like it at all. I draw in Autocad all day and use the roller to zoom all the time so this is a problem for me. My husband opened this up while i was away so i cant return but i will give it to him to use with his home laptop. :/
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised although i never use any of the side buttons. now that i am more comfortable with it wished i had purchased a smaller one for lighter weight portability since this is mated with a laptop. i like the way the usb receiver 'thing' stores inside the mouse which is where i keep a spare; the external keyboard uses the same receiver so i have an extra. i give it 4 stars since i don't find the side buttons applicable but that is a personal problem, eh? logitech is the only company i have ever purchased this type accessory from and will continue to do so until given a performance reason to change.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Was great for 18months
customer_reviews.text: So I am changing my overall rating because after about a year and a half, the left click sensors are dying. I had to break out my smaller mouse (used for work) in order to do any work on my home computer. I've been a huge user of Logitech products but this is super disappointing. I've replaced the batteries and moved the wifi dongle to different areas on my computer tower without success. As of right now, it's mostly useless. That said: Size wise and ergonomically it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Madame de Fer

customer_reviews.title: Basic Affordable Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I work a lot on my laptop and I got tired of the touchpad. I decided to invest in an affordable wireless mouse and this little bugger did not disappoint. It is plug and play (insert USB receiver and use). The battery has lasted me at least 2 months with 3+ hours of use per day. I like the different thumb buttons, which worked without having to assign them. This is a perfect basic affordable mouse for regular folk and non-computer savvy folk. Insert the receiver and start using it. I haven't assigned any buttons or had to search for software to install a driver -- it was automatic.
customer_reviews.author: SaraRx

customer_reviews.title: Like most Logitech products it work great with no issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first "Logitech M510 Wireless Computer Mouse". Being an IT pro I buy lots of mice and this is one of my favorites. They have great range, they don't go to sleep to quickly and the batteries last. In fact the only issue I've ever had was when a flash memory stick or other device is plugged in next to this or any other RF device it tends to interfere with it's function, but this is not the mouses fault, those memory sticks should be RF shielded.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Hart-Adams

customer_reviews.title: Ours was unstable. I've found better for cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: It started out a little glitchy, but I thought it was just something weird with my operating system. Pretty soon became unusable. It double-clicks all the time when you don't want it to, won't click and hold at other times when you want it to for selecting text, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lawman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I used to really like this type of mouse. I had ones that lasted me a long time. This has lasted 6 months and it's not connecting to my Mac. I changed the battery 3 times. I turned off and on many times. I changed USB slots and it wont work Very frustrating and trying to register it under Logitech and get customer support to help is just not even worth the $20 refund. Why can't companies just make good products that last. I now have to move onto another type of mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MelC

customer_reviews.title: What A Difference!
customer_reviews.text: With so many brands of a wireless mouse to choose from these days, it's easy to think they're all the same, and make a purchase decision based on price alone. With the last two I've purchased I can tell you that is not the case. When the need arose to get a new one, I went with this one from Logitech, the tried and true brand for years. Boy, what a difference. Very smooth motion, smooth scrolling, and no more mis-clicks. Also, Logitech provides software to not only customize the behavior of the mouse, you can tailor the settings for individual applications. All this plus a promised battery life, (batteries included), of 24 months makes for a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Died after two months of use
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this in January, but didn't start using it until May. A few months into using it and I slowly started having problems with the mouse not working (using the USB plugin for connectivity) and now it does not work at all. I've turned it off and on, changed the batteries... it does not work. I'd recommend NOT buying this mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse in October of 2017. It is now late July 2019 and I've finally gotten the "low battery" warning. A 21 month battery life being connected to a desktop computer and turned on 24/7 seems pretty good to me. I'm sure the batteries would last much longer if I were turning the mouse off every night or using it with a laptop only when traveling. While not the fanciest mouse in the world it gets the job done, it's comfortable enough and has proven durable for me. Perhaps the best description is to say that while this is an inexpensive mouse, it isn't "cheap."
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Real PNP
customer_reviews.text: Real Plug 'n Play. I have worn out 3 wireless mice. Not breaking them from dropping but just quit working after a long life. This is not the first Logitech mouse I have had but is is performing as well as any of the others I have. It was just as easy to use, just plug in the dongle and turn on the mouse with a new battery in it. The receiver in the dongle found it immediately and it was working. No problems, no issues. I'll buy another when I wear out the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Don O

customer_reviews.title: Connection Starts Dropping After a Year of Use
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this mouse. That's why when my first one started dropping its connection after a year I just bought a new one hoping it was a fluke. It wasn't. My new mouse started having the same issues after around the same period of time. It's most notable when trying to drag and drop, and the mouse drops the item before you release the button.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING WITHIN MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in June and by September it stopped working. Amazon is replacing it but my only options were replacing or return it with a restocking fee of $5 (apparently it is usually a 20% restocking fee so even that was supposedly some great favor they were doing for me). I'll see when the replacement arrives and how it works but I hope everyone else has a chance to use this enough to figure out whether it is a good product before this happens to them.
customer_reviews.author: S K

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and in less than a year the left mouse button stopped working correctly. I bought a second one and this one has quickly developed the same issue in a few months. It often registers a single click as two or more, and dragging/dropping only works reliably when using a LOT of pressure on the button. Basically the switches inside are garbage. It's not a total loser though. It fits the hand well, and when it works properly it's very nice. Very long battery life. I just wish they didn't cheap out on the basics. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: AmznRvw

customer_reviews.title: Freezes often
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time trying the Logitech wireless mouse. I have a close connection between the USB port and mouse, new batteries in it, and have tried with and without mousepad. It sucks. It's a cheap-o product that causes your cursor to stall and freeze. Turning it on and off, replacing batteries, resetting the whole thing, updating Logitech software - nothing works. Just like the first mouse, this brand new, second mouse is a total waste of money. I'm back to using my wired, old mouse that works 100x better. Past the return date now, while trying everything. Going to have to throw this away. Again. Save yourself the headache and get a higher quality mouse.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pro CAD designer and I'm on my third one of these. (The second one died because I got mad and destroyed it. These are actually very sturdy mouses.) I love this mouse because it has back and forward buttons, a good scroll wheel and a nice for for my hand. I've only recently began using the side side scroll function on the wheel and I really love it. This mouse is a great deal for the price. Such a huge upgrade from the garbage that comes with computers. I recommend getting a good mouse pad too. I bought a 12x30 big gaming one and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Customer support as unresponsive as mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very poor. Mouse was barely responsive on any surface despite following every recommended "restart" step on the Logitech website, including changing ports, restarting the computer, resetting the mouse multiple times, and reinstalling all drivers. Logitech direct customer support was not responsive and their message boards show this is not an uncommon problem. This product is very highly rated, so hopefully only a small section of customers are having this problem. Logitech products used to be much more reliable than they are now. If the Amazon replacement has the same issue, my next mouse will not be from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Full-sized, comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows comparison with Logitech M317. Pretty decent design, the sides have a silicon finish, that's comfortable to hold. Has couple of Up/Down buttons on the side. The mouse clicks are soft. The scroll wheel also can be pushed to the Left/Right to pan left/right on large pages. One tiny issue I have is, the scroll wheel press is too loud for my taste, but it's pretty sturdy. Since it takes 2 AA batteries, the mouse has a good weight to it. Even if I accidentally knock it, mouse doesn't go flying off the table, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Saketharam

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Everyday computing with Thinkpad laptop, occasional use with Samsung smart tv, etc. I don't play computer games that much so I can't truly say whether it works well for that purpose. However, I find the M510 Logitech Wireless Laser Mouse to have a minimal latency period at worst, ample buttons for various uses, quite comfortable in hand, and responsive on many surfaces one would not expect. Also very durable; it has hit the concrete from 3-4 feet up on numerous occasions and survived. Buy one, or more, and don't drop them... I've been very lucky!
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK Left Handed
customer_reviews.text: I'm right handed but I use a mouse with my left hand as it frees my right hand for keyboard inputs - this approach is handy for cad work. When my old MS mouse died and I looked for a replacement it seemed that all the mice available were heavily contoured to be supposedly ergonomic for right hand use. That wasn't going to work for me. This one appeared to be pretty symmetrical and the transition from the MS mouse to this one was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gober

customer_reviews.title: A good mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bigger than I was looking for but it's a good, reliable mouse so far. Not a gamer. Not sure about sleep mode. I use it with my laptop and turn it off when not in use. I just needed something that wouldn't take up too much room in my bag but not super small like a travel mouse.
customer_reviews.author: chukmac

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse -- pull the tab, pop the tiny dongle into a USB port, and it's set! No program to install, drivers to manage, or anything else. It just works, and works well. (Of course, you can adjust its default values through normal settings, if you so desire). It goes to sleep on its own, or you can slide a switch on and off if you want more control. This is my second of these mice, and batteries last me 4-6 months, which seems extremely reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ricket

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this seeing as it was Amazon's choice, and had a lot of positive reviews. When I first got the mouse it was fine, worked great. After a few weeks (when the return window closed), it started going to sleep or disconnecting. It wasn't often at first but is becoming more and more. The batteries were replaced and are brand new, and I have another Logitech mouse that I use that works fine. Now even the left mouse button is having issues. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JynXed

customer_reviews.title: Best 5 button mouse with programable buttons
customer_reviews.text: Ive used the Logitech M510 for many years since i found it at walmart 6 years ago Since then i had to buy a new M510 Due to looseing the reciver was cheap to replace the whole mouse ~$20 This is the best quality 5 button mouse with scroll wheel and programable macros for a reasonable price with AA battery support Exialent build quality takes a beating ~ 1 year battery life with daily computer use
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Left button doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse in August 2019, and here I am in May 2020 with a left mouse button that is intermittent. This is disappointing considering how nicely I treat my electronics. I'm the guy who usually gets three years out of a cell phone or five years out of a laptop. I upgrade because I've used something long beyond what was considered to be its lifetime - not because I've broken it. Yet, here I am, with an expensive mouse that's less than a year old, but needs to be replaced due to a failing button.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade from a smaller logitech mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a smaller logitech mouse, since my old mouse had been giving me hand cramps with prolonged use while working from home. This definitely has a more ergonomic shape, and my hand no longer cramps while using it for several hours. The back and forward buttons on the side don't often get much use from me though. It's also heavier than some of the mice I've used in the past, which I suppose probably helps for playing games
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade since a few years ago
customer_reviews.text: This is my second M510. I got one maybe 4 years ago. My only gripe was the laser eye had no cover over it, allowing the occasional hair or dust to get in there and mess with tracking. This new one, purchased in early 2019, has a clear cover over the eye and a few subtle design changes. It remains a very well made and comfortable mouse to use for long periods. And the battery life is outstanding. I use it for work, so long hours every day, and the batteries last about two years!
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: ... GONE WAY DOWN AND THERTE TOP SHELF STUFF IS GARBAGE TOO TRY SOME OF THESE OFF BRANDS LESS MONEY ...
customer_reviews.text: NO0T A LOGITECH FAN ANY MORE THERE PRODUT QUALITY HJAS GONE WAY DOWN AND THERTE TOP SHELF STUFF IS GARBAGE TOO TRY SOME OF THESE OFF BRANDS LESS MONEY SAME CRAP TRUE FACT LOODGITECH IS FOLLOWING APPLE AND SOMESANG,MAKING PRODUCTS TO BREAK EASY MORE SALES AND FIXING PHONES IS A BILLION DOLLAR INDUSTRY .I KNOW THIS ISNT A PHONE BUT SAME CEOS
customer_reviews.author: steve troyer

customer_reviews.title: Left and Right click no mouse movement.
customer_reviews.text: Any item that uses Logitech Unifying software eventually goes out and stops working correctly. I purchased this mouse once recently and already only the left and right clicks are registered no mouse movement worked. I reinstalled the unifying software tried to use both dongles and 1 dongle. Reinstalled the drivers and it still didn't fix the issue I will never buy another wireless logitech item again. I also purchased 2 wireless logitech keyboards both with the same issue of some keys not registering at all. Infuriating so I took them into the garage and smashed them with a big hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for about 10 months, and that by no means is a crazy lifespan for a mouse. It used to work perfectly, had zero complaints, but as of lately it does not ever turn off and now my mouse just does not work. I've changed batteries in it and done all that I can do. I ordered a new mouse from somewhere else, because working from home is too much without a reliable mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Davalos

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Responsive. 🖱
customer_reviews.text: Just received this mouse today. 🖱 It is similar to a Logitech I had a few years ago, but I hope it lasts longer... (last one about 3 years) 🤷🏽‍♀️ That said, this mouse is responsive and comfortable. I've only used it a short while, but I know I like it. I got a good sale price on it, so, there's not much to complain about, so far. 😬 Even at full price, the mouse is probably worth it. Well made. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Just got tired of a wired mouse
customer_reviews.text: My desktop computer came with a wired mouse and the cord was always getting caught on something. It's a pleasure to use and is the same size as the mouse that came with the computer. It can be set up for left or right-hand use with software you download from Logitech. I don't care for gaming and don't know if it has a sleep mode but it can be turned off but they claim the batteris provided will last 3 years so I leav it on.
customer_reviews.author: John Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Ordered in March, now Dec...not working
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this mouse since March ( approx 8 months) and despite after changing the batteries 3 times with brand new batteries from Duracell, Energizer, and Kirkland the mouse continues to malfunction. It will stop moving the pointer. I'm disappointed that this mouse has given me problems vs the cheap mini Logitech mouse I bought 5 years ago (small and portable, but not comfortable if you have big hands). I purchased this mouse for my office. It is comfortable and seems to be made with good external materials. The internal components can use some work.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Kane

product_meta.title: Logitech M510 Wireless Computer Mouse – Comfortable Shape with USB Unifying Receiver, with Back/Forward Buttons and Side-to-Side Scrolling, Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:Dark Blue| Pattern Name:Single

With its contoured shape, soft rubber grips and handy controls, the Logitech Wireless Mouse M510 gives you more control, so you can do more with your mouse. System Requirements: Windows 10 Windows 8 Windows 7|Chrome OS|Linux Kernel 2.6+|USB port. Sensor Resolution - 1000

System Requirements:

Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7

Chrome OS

Linux Kernel 2.6+

USB port
feature_bullets: ERGONOMIC SHAPE:Ergonomically sculpted design and soft rubber grips conform to your right or left hand to be naturally comfortable and the compact size makes it easy to take with you wherever you use your computer at home, at work, or anywhere else
CONVENIENT CONTROLS: Back/forward buttons and side to side scrolling plus zoom let you do more, faster (requires free Logitech Options software)

LONG BATTERY LIFE: You might forget this mouse runs on batteries with 2 years of power from 2 AA batteries. Mouse Dimensions (height x width x depth) - 4.72 in (120 millimeter) x 2.56 in (65 millimeter) x 1.61 in (41 millimeter). Receiver Dimensions (height x width x depth)- 0.57 in (14.4 millimeter) x 0.74 in (18.7 millimeter) x 0.24 in (6.1 millimeter)
PROGRAMMABLE CONTROLS: Configure the buttons to do exactly what you want like switching applications, opening browser windows or jump to full screen while watching videos

PLUG'N'PLAY CONNECTION: Nano sized Logitech wireless unifying receiver stays in your computer plug it in, forget it, even add compatible wireless devices without multiple USB receivers USB connector is located underneath the item inside where the batteries are stored
